news.title: Trump administration announces fees on Chinese ships docking at U.S. ports
news.summary: The Trump administration on Thursday announced fees on Chinese-built vessels. The fees are expected to be in the region of $1,000 per vessel.

news.title: Google hit with second antitrust blow, adding to concerns about future of ads business
news.summary: A federal judge ruled on Thursday that Google held illegal monopolies in online advertising markets. Google's position between ad buyers and sellers made it illegal, the judge said.

news.title: Trump again calls for Fed to cut rates, says Powell’s ‘termination cannot come fast enough’
news.summary: President Donald Trump again called for the Federal Reserve to lower rates. He even hinted at the "termination" of Chair Jerome Powell. The Fed is expected to raise interest rates on Thursday.

news.title: Canadian small businesses are taking Trump's tariffs personally
news.summary: Canadian national pride has sparked resistance and inspired action from small businesses. The Canadian national pride movement has been dubbed the "Canadian pride movement" The movement has also been dubbed "The Canadian Pride Movement" and "Canadian Pride"

news.title: Where 'Made in China 2025' missed the mark
news.summary: Beijing's Made in China' 2025 had ambitious goals. 10 years on, it's failed to meet several targets. Beijing's 'Made in China 2025' has been scaled back by the Chinese government.

news.title: Are small-cap stocks cheaper than large caps? Yes — if you ignore this one key fact.
news.summary: Money-losing companies make the Russell 2000 look more attractively priced. Leaving money-l losing companies out of P/E calculations makes the index look more attractive.

news.title: Money talks with your parents are tough. Here’s how and why you need to have them.
news.summary: It’s time to take the taboo out of family financial conversations. It's time to start talking about your finances with your family. It is time to talk about your financial future.

news.title: Netflix wants to be a $1 trillion company. Earnings show why that’s a reasonable goal.
news.summary: Analysts see Netflix generating growth even in a recession. Analysts expect Netflix to continue to grow even if the U.S. economy is in recession.

news.title: Is the stock market open today? Are banks closed?
news.summary: Don't forget the bond markets, either. Here’s what you need to know. And don’t forget the stock markets, too.

news.title: Economists share where they look for clues that a U.S. recession could be coming
news.summary: Tariffs are going to hit the economy hard, but a serious downturn is not inevitable, economists say. The U.S. is in the midst of a trade war with China.
